citation.article-title: Alicycliphilus denitrificans gen. nov., sp. nov., a cyclohexanol-degrading, nitrate-reducing beta-proteobacterium.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Alicycliphilus (a.li.cyc.li′phi.lus. Gr. adj. aliphos fat; Gr. n. kyklos, circle or ring; N.L. adj. alicyclo referring to circular fat-like organic compounds; Gr. masc. n. philos friend; N.L. adj. Alicycliphilus alicyclic compound-liking, referring to the substrates used for the isolation of this organism).
Cells are short rods (0·6×1–2 μm), motile, Gram-negative, catalase- and oxidase-positive.
Optimal growth occurs at 28–30 °C and pH 7·2–7·4 under aerobic or anoxic conditions.
Electron acceptors nitrate, nitrite and oxygen are used; sulfate, sulfite and fumarate are not reduced.
Phylogenetically related to the family Comamonadaceae.
